dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: General Secretary To Lam's arrival in Kazakhstan is the first such high-level contact between the two countries in years.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: General Secretary To Lam's arrival in Kazakhstan is the first such high-level contact between the two countries in years.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: In his Telegram channel, Shatalov emphasized that this is the first contact of such level between the two countries in recent years.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: Yeah, and it's not just a stopover before the Victory Parade in Moscow—Nikita Shatalov really emphasized that it's an independent political choice.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yeah, and it's not just a stopover before the Victory Parade in Moscow-Nikita Shatalov really emphasized that it's an independent political choice.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Chronologically, the visit precedes To Lam's participation in the Victory Parade in Moscow, but Kazakhstan is not just a transit point. It is an independent, multi-layered political choice.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: Exactly, and he pointed out that under To Lam, Vietnam is reinforcing its foreign policy agency, what they call the "bamboo policy"—flexible but resilient.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Exactly, and he pointed out that under To Lam, Vietnam is reinforcing its foreign policy agency, what they call the bamboo policy-flexible but resilient.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Firstly, under To Lam, Vietnam is actively reinforcing the agency of its foreign policy. Since the 1980s, Vietnam has consistently pursued a multi-vector foreign policy known as the ˜bamboo policy' " flexible, yet resilient, Shatalov explained.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: Right, and Kazakhstan offers Vietnam access to Central Asia, while Vietnam brings one of Southeast Asia's fastest-growing markets, with like, 7% average GDP growth over the past decade.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Right, and Kazakhstan offers Vietnam access to Central Asia, while Vietnam brings one of Southeast Asia's fastest-growing markets, with like, seven percent average G D P growth over the past decade.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: For Kazakhstan, Vietnam represents one of the fastest-growing markets in Southeast Asia (with an average GDP growth of around 7% over the past 10 years), offering direct access to the RCEP and the Pacific region.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: So there's real potential here for logistics, like connecting the Trans-Caspian corridor to Vietnam's seaports, plus energy and tech cooperation.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: So there's real potential here for logistics, like connecting the Trans-Caspian corridor to Vietnam's seaports, plus energy and tech cooperation.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: According to Shatalov, this context could lead to discussions on connecting logistics routes (Trans-Caspian corridor " Vietnam's seaports), energy and technological cooperation, market access, and coordination in UN and Non-Aligned Movement platforms, which are gaining new momentum amid the rising agency of the Global South.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: And To Lam himself gives this visit extra weight—he's not just a party leader, he's a security official who's consolidated control over both internal and foreign policy.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: And To Lam himself gives this visit extra weight-he's not just a party leader, he's a security official who's consolidated control over both internal and foreign policy.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Thirdly, To Lam's persona gives this visit special weight. He's not just a party leader " he's a security official who has consolidated control over both the internal and foreign agenda.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: In less than a year, he's visited China, Malaysia, Singapore, the US… and now Kazakhstan. That's pretty telling.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: In less than a year, he's visited China, Malaysia, Singapore, the U S... and now Kazakhstan. That's pretty telling.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Traditionally, CPV general secretaries acted as internal arbiters, but To Lam has expanded that role: in less than a year, he has visited China, Malaysia, Singapore, the US " and now Kazakhstan.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: And his meeting in Astana with Kazakhstan's president—a seasoned diplomat—is especially relevant with Trump's trade war escalation affecting Vietnam too.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: And his meeting in Astana with Kazakhstan's president-a seasoned diplomat-is especially relevant with Trump's trade war escalation affecting Vietnam too.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: In Astana, he will meet with our President " a seasoned diplomat with unique expertise on the region and the EU, especially relevant in the context of Trump's actions and the escalation of the trade war, which also affects Vietnam.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: Shatalov called it a dialogue between two heavyweights from different spheres: diplomacy and internal security.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Shatalov called it a dialogue between two heavyweights from different spheres: diplomacy and internal security.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: This is not a routine meeting " it's a dialogue between two heavyweights from different spheres " diplomacy and internal security, Shatalov emphasized.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: It's really about middle powers refusing to be pawns in superpower games—they're shaping their own partnership strategies.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: It's really about middle powers refusing to be pawns in superpower games-they're shaping their own partnership strategies.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: According to him, middle powers don't want to be pawns in a game between superpowers. They are learning to shape their own partnership strategies " in the interests of free trade, sovereignty, and sustainable prosperity.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: For free trade, sovereignty, sustainable prosperity… that's what's bringing Hanoi and Astana closer than it might seem.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: For free trade, sovereignty, sustainable prosperity... that's what's bringing Hanoi and Astana closer than it might seem.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: This is what truly brings Hanoi and Astana closer today " much more than it may seem at first glance, Shatalov concluded.
